page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: THE AREA IS PART OF THE LOW-LYING VALE OF YORK. MOST OF THE LAND IS FARMED. THE RIVERS NIDD AND OUSE RELIEVE THE MONOTONY AS THEY FLOW BETWEEN STEEP BANKS. THERE ARE MANY SMALL TREE PLANTATIONS KNOWN AS {RASHES}AND TWO COUNTRY PARKS USED FOR GRAZING. BOTH RIVERS ARE SUBJECT TO SEVERE FLOODING AND FLOOD BANKS AND CAUSEWAYS HAVE BEEN CONSTRUCTED. HALF THE BLOCK REMAINS AS WATER MEADOWS OR {INGS}AND IMPROVED GRASSLAND. THERE ARE MANY DRAINAGE DITCHES, SOME OLD AND WINDING ARE FRINGED BY TREES AND SHRUBS. MANY OLD HEDGES HAVE SURVIVED BUT SOME LARGE FIELDS HAVE BEEN MADE. THE GENERAL FLATNESS OF THE AREA BRINGS INTO PROMINENCE DISTANT PLANTATIONS SO THAT THE LANDSCAPE APPEARS WELL WOODED.INTO 2 COUNTRY PARKS FOREIGN SPECIMEN TREES HAVE BEEN INTRODUCED AND THE OPEN SPACES PRESERVED.
